title: Dryanovo Municipality
text:
Dryanovo (or Drjanovo) Municipality () is a <a href="Municipalities%20of%20Bulgaria">municipality</a> ("<a href="obshtina">obshtina</a>") in <a href="Gabrovo%20Province">Gabrovo Province</a>, North-central <a href="Bulgaria">Bulgaria</a>, located in the area of the so-called <a href="Fore-Balkan">Fore-Balkan</a> between <a href="Stara%20planina">Stara planina</a> mountain and the <a href="Danubian%20Plain%20%28Bulgaria%29">Danubian Plain</a>. It is named after its administrative centre - the town of <a href="Dryanovo">Dryanovo</a>.
The municipality embraces a territory of 248.5 km² with a population of 9,587 inhabitants, as of December 2011.
The area is best known with the <a href="Dryanovo%20Monastery">Dryanovo Monastery</a>, situated close to the main town, and <a href="Bacho%20Kiro%20Cave">Bacho Kiro Cave</a>.
